sentence.Network_en: Usually his cases involved errant husbands and wandering wives.
sentence.Network_cn: 通常他接的案子都涉及出轨的丈夫和离家出走的妻子。

sentence.Network_en: To keep their bees from wandering, beekeepers feed them sugar solutions.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了防止蜜蜂迷路，养蜂人给它们喝糖水。

sentence.Network_en: A phrase from the conference floor set my mind wandering.
sentence.Network_cn: 会上发言者的一句话让我思绪飘远。

encyclopedia.content: wandering 英音：['wɔndəriŋ]美音：['wɑndərɪŋ] 词典解释形容词a. 1. 徘徊的；流浪的 2. 蜿蜒的；曲折的 3. 错乱的；恍惚的 名词n. 1. 锛埑８词級流浪；精神错乱 网络解释 1. 漂游 光电英语词汇(W) | 英语迷 wandering 漂游 Wandering 1. 彷徨锛埪逞缸髌芳級 英汉对照：中国传统文化词汇大拼盘 - 奥鹏。.. 44 .彷徨锛埪逞缸髌芳級 Wandering

entry.def: Wandering is used to describe people who travel around rather than staying in one place for a long time.

means.word_mean: 1. travelling about without any clear destination;

sentences.sentence: "she followed him in his wanderings and looked after him"

means.word_mean: 1. (of groups of people) tending to travel and change settlements frequently;

sentences.sentence: "believed the profession of a peregrine typist would have a happy future"

auth_sentence.content: These days, Garrie is a wandering French teacher.

sentences.en: I felt my attention wandering during the lecture.
sentences.cn: 我感到听讲座时老走神。

sentences.en: She was supposed to be speaking about sales figures, but she kept wandering off the subject.
sentences.cn: 她本该谈论销售数字，但她老是跑题。

sentences.en: Don’t go wandering all over the house!
sentences.cn: 不要在房子里到处转悠！
